project.name: emuteca
project.description:
En español abajo.
Sorry, my bad "Engrish".
Emuteca is an emulator front-end for any system, like QuickPlay. Now, it's in English; and it can be translated to any language (I think so...).
It's not complete, but it's somewhat stable and usable... :/. The main visible problems are: Transparent background of PNG is always showed black and ICO files don't resize to fit game list rows. These problems are already fixed in 0.6.2.XX source code, but i want to test more before release it.
Features:
Support for ROMs inside a 7z, zip, rar, and any other format that 7zip can handle; and extract the ROM (or all files) before launching the emulator. Alternatively, you can use the compressed file itself as a ROM; for example, while you are using MAME. Group games by families, in many system a family means diferent versions of the same game; while in other it's better use families to handle the diferent files of the same game (computer games with many discs). It launchs any emulator from command line; althought only some are preconfigured as example, you can add many as you want. Some emulators don't support launch a game from command line but you can use Emuteca to decompress the ROM before lauching the emulator or only for management purpose. You can add, edit, delete or disable any system with the System Manager. Emulator Manager lets you configure the command line for the emulators. It has a Media Manager to rename media files assign them to a family or a game NEW: It's in English by default, but can be translated. NEW: You can assign a video or/and a music file to a game and it can be played went selecting the game (only MPEG and MIDI was actually tested) Other little things that you may discover XD. Some things like video and music folders (except demo folders) are useless in this version... If you want to traslate Emuteca to another language or fix any misspelled sentence: Run Emuteca at least once (This will create some config files, and the translation file of the strings used). If you want open any other window like System Manager, Emulator Manager, etc... this will add their strings to the traslation file too. The file with the strings is "i18n\en.lng" folder (by default), and you only need to edit this file. With Emuteca is included only es.lng for Spanish, but at first run "en.lng" will be created. If you want, you can copy or rename the file and then change Emuteca.ini... (and send me the translation XD to include it in next version) Sorry, not more documentation in English; if you want, you can help me to translate the documentation to any languaje.
Now in Spanish
No es una traducción literal de lo anterior, pero como todas las páginas de la wiki están en español... ¡recórretelas!
Emuteca es un interfaz (front-end) de emuladores de cualquier sistema para Windows, estilo QuickPlay. Ahora por defecto está en inglés, pero incluyo la traducción al español. Para usarlo edita el archivo "Emuteca.ini" y cambia "File=en.lng" por "File=es.lng".
Entre sus características están:
Soporte de ROM en 7z, zip, rar, en definitiva todos los formatos que soporta 7zip (alternativamente también se puede hacer que los propios archivos comprimidos sean la ROM en sí, por ejemplo con MAME) Agrupación de juegos por familias, y agrupar los listados por desarrollador, año y palabras clave Soporta básicamente cualquier emulador que permita ejecutar juegos desde la línea de comandos. Tiene gestor de sistemas para añadir, modificar y eliminar la configuración de sistemas. Gestor emuladores donde definir los parámetros de la línea de comandos para ejecutar directamente el juego. Gestor de archivos multimedia para renombrar los archivos correspondientes semiautomáticamente. Ahora puede reproducir un vídeo o música del juego seleccionado (solo lo he probado con MPEGs y MIDIs)
